intro: Koenigia polystachya, commonly known as the silverleaf carnation, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is also known as the ice plant family. The plant features succulent, fleshy leaves that are often covered in a fine layer of white powder, giving it a silvery appearance. Its flowers are typically pink or purple, arranged in dense, branched clusters. Koenigia polystachya is well adapted to arid environments and is often used in rock gardens due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
